meanings.definition: To make something conform to a standard
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to standardize their essays to follow the same format.
meanings.sent2: It is important to standardize the procedures to ensure consistency in the results.
meanings.sent3: Trying to standardize the chaos of my room felt like an impossible task.
meanings.sent4: She tried to standardize her daily routine, but life always threw unexpected surprises.
meanings.sent5: The company decided to standardize their products to meet customer expectations.

meanings.definition: To establish a standard for something
meanings.sent1: The committee aimed to standardize the safety regulations for all industries.
meanings.sent2: The goal is to standardize the quality control measures across all branches.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to standardize the perfect sandwich recipe became a neighborhood legend.
meanings.sent4: The artist sought to standardize his unique style in the competitive art world.
meanings.sent5: The government decided to standardize the tax laws to simplify the process for citizens.
